fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • An article about delays to Ryanair’s Boeing 737 Max deliveries incorrectly described planes in the airline’s current fleet as 737-200s. It should have said 737-800s (Ryanair counts the cost of delays to 737 Max delivery, 5 November, page 33). • Early editions on Wednesday carried the headline “Ofcom orders more lenient marking in GCSE French and German” (page 11). Ofqual is the qualifications regulator, not Ofcom, which oversees broadcasting and communications. • Other recently corrected articles include: NHS ‘tax trap’ pensions causing frontline shortages, doctors warn Smashing the patriarchy: why there’s nothing natural about male supremacy
